alert.note: Alert for Cascades in Lane County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 02 at 11:50AM PST until January 04 at 12:00AM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM MONDAY TO MIDNIGHT PST MONDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 15 to 32 inches with locally higher amounts at higher elevations. Lesser amounts likely below 2000 ft. South winds gusting as high as 55 to 65 mph. * WHERE...Cascades in Lane County. * WHEN...From 4 AM Monday to midnight PST Monday night. * IMPACTS...Travel may be very hazardous. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Very strong winds could cause extensive tree damage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow levels will lower from around 3500 ft to near 1500 to 2500 ft by early Monday afternoon.
info.instruction: Keep an eye on the forecast for updates on the situation. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Slow down and allow extra time when travelling. Practice your winter safety rules. Keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your car in case of emergency. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1, or visit https://www.tripcheck.com
